page.title: 01Kettlesing Area - A Panorama
page.content: This is a 3 x 4 km. area of rolling hillsides, cut by moorland becks, e.g., Tang Beck. The moor rises to over 230 metres at Menwith Hill. It is approx. 6 miles NW of Harrogate; the A59 cuts through the block W to E. It is a rural area, mainly agricul- tural especially dairying, with sheep- farming on the higher land, and inter- spersed with natural and planted woodlands, mainly deciduous. It is an area of scattered hamlets, centred on Kettlesing, but encompassing High Birstwith and Men- with Hill, its population engaged in agriculture or commuting to jobs in the Harrogate area. The M.O.D./U.S. communications station at Menwith Hill lies in the western quarter of the block. This is a self-contained base of resident U.S. citizens.
